metadata.description: Phase 1: Expansion of underrepresented historical periods - Early Medieval (500-999), 17th Century, 20th Century, and non-European figures

figures.name: Justinian I
figures.title: Byzantine Emperor
figures.description: Byzantine emperor from 527 to 565 CE. Commissioned Hagia Sophia, codified Roman law in Corpus Juris Civilis, reconquered former Western Roman territories.

figures.name: Theodora
figures.title: Byzantine Empress
figures.description: Byzantine empress, wife of Justinian I. Rose from humble origins to become co-ruler. Instrumental in Nika Revolt decisions and women's rights reforms.

figures.name: Louis XIV
figures.title: King of France
figures.description: King of France from 1643 to 1715, longest-reigning European monarch. Known as the Sun King, built Palace of Versailles, epitomized absolute monarchy.

figures.name: Molière
figures.title: Playwright and Actor
figures.description: French playwright, actor, poet. Created comedies including Tartuffe, The Misanthrope, and Le Bourgeois gentilhomme. Transformed French theater.

figures.name: René Descartes
figures.title: Philosopher and Mathematician
figures.description: French philosopher, mathematician, scientist. Father of modern philosophy. Famous for 'Cogito, ergo sum' ('I think, therefore I am'). Developed Cartesian geometry.

figures.name: Rembrandt van Rijn
figures.title: Painter
figures.description: Dutch painter, master of light and shadow. Created The Night Watch, self-portraits. One of greatest visual artists in history.

figures.name: Oliver Cromwell
figures.title: Lord Protector of England
figures.description: Military and political leader. Led Parliamentarian forces against King Charles I. Lord Protector of Commonwealth of England, Scotland, and Ireland 1653-1658.

figures.name: Nzinga of Ndongo and Matamba
figures.title: Queen of Ndongo and Matamba
figures.description: Queen of the Ambundu kingdoms of Ndongo and Matamba in present-day Angola. Led 30-year resistance against Portuguese colonization and slave trade.

figures.name: Shaka kaSenzangakhona
figures.title: King of the Zulu Kingdom
figures.description: Zulu king who transformed the Zulu from a small clan into a major military power. Developed revolutionary military tactics and state organization.

figures.name: Emperor Taizong of Tang
figures.title: Emperor of China
figures.description: Second emperor of Tang Dynasty (r. 626-649). His reign became model for future emperors. Expanded territory, promoted culture and learning. 'Reign of Zhenguan' considered golden age.

figures.name: Wu Zetian
figures.title: Empress of China
figures.description: Only female sovereign in Chinese history. Founded Zhou dynasty (690-705), interrupting Tang. Ruled as de facto leader from 665. Promoted meritocracy and Buddhism.

figures.name: Mahatma Gandhi
figures.title: Political and Spiritual Leader
figures.description: Leader of Indian independence movement. Pioneered nonviolent resistance (Satyagraha) against British rule. Influenced civil rights movements worldwide.

figures.name: Nelson Mandela
figures.title: President of South Africa
figures.description: Anti-apartheid revolutionary. Imprisoned 27 years. First Black president of South Africa (1994-1999). Nobel Peace Prize 1993. Symbol of reconciliation.

figures.name: Marie Curie
figures.title: Physicist and Chemist
figures.description: Polish-French physicist and chemist. First woman to win Nobel Prize, only person to win in two sciences (Physics 1903, Chemistry 1911). Pioneered radioactivity research.

figures.name: Bede
figures.title: Monk and Scholar
figures.description: Anglo-Saxon Benedictine monk, author of 'Ecclesiastical History of the English People'. Father of English history. Doctor of the Church.

figures.name: Abd al-Rahman III
figures.title: Caliph of Córdoba
figures.description: First Umayyad Caliph of Córdoba. Transformed Al-Andalus into most prosperous state in Europe. Patron of arts, sciences. Built Madinat al-Zahra.

figures.name: Murasaki Shikibu
figures.title: Novelist and Court Lady
figures.description: Japanese novelist, poet, lady-in-waiting. Author of 'The Tale of Genji', considered world's first novel. Key figure in Japanese literature.

figures.name: Saladin
figures.title: Sultan of Egypt and Syria
figures.description: First Sultan of Egypt and Syria. Founded Ayyubid dynasty. Recaptured Jerusalem from Crusaders (1187). Known for chivalry and military genius.

figures.name: Genghis Khan
figures.title: Founder of Mongol Empire
figures.description: Founded and first Great Khan of Mongol Empire, largest contiguous empire in history. Unified Mongol tribes. Conquered much of Eurasia.

figures.name: Mansa Musa
figures.title: Mansa of Mali Empire
figures.description: Ninth Mansa of Mali Empire. Possibly wealthiest person in history. Famous pilgrimage to Mecca (1324-1325). Patron of education and architecture.

works.title: Versailles
works.creator: Simon Mirren and David Wolstencroft
works.description: Historical drama about construction of Palace of Versailles during reign of Louis XIV. Aired 2015-2018 on Canal+.

works.title: African Queens: Njinga
works.creator: Jada Pinkett Smith
works.description: Netflix docudrama about Queen Njinga of Ndongo and Matamba, produced and narrated by Jada Pinkett Smith.

works.title: Shaka iLembe
works.creator: Bomb Productions
works.description: South African historical drama about Shaka Zulu's life from childhood to kingship. Largest South African TV production.

works.title: Cromwell
works.creator: Ken Hughes
works.description: Historical drama film about Oliver Cromwell's rise and the English Civil War. Starring Richard Harris and Alec Guinness.

works.title: Molière
works.creator: Laurent Tirard
works.description: French biographical film about playwright Molière's early years. Starring Romain Duris.

works.title: Nightwatching
works.creator: Peter Greenaway
works.description: Biographical drama about Rembrandt van Rijn and the creation of 'The Night Watch'.

works.title: Gandhi
works.creator: Richard Attenborough
works.description: Epic biographical film about Mahatma Gandhi. Won 8 Academy Awards including Best Picture. Starring Ben Kingsley.

works.title: Mandela: Long Walk to Freedom
works.creator: Justin Chadwick
works.description: Biographical film based on Nelson Mandela's autobiography. Starring Idris Elba.

works.title: Marie Curie: The Courage of Knowledge
works.creator: Marie Noëlle
works.description: Biographical drama about Marie Curie's scientific career and personal life. French-German-Polish co-production.

works.title: Radioactive
works.creator: Marjane Satrapi
works.description: Biographical film about Marie Curie starring Rosamund Pike. Based on graphic novel by Lauren Redniss.

works.title: Kingdom of Heaven
works.creator: Ridley Scott
works.description: Epic historical drama set during the Crusades. Features Saladin. Starring Orlando Bloom.

works.title: Mongol
works.creator: Sergei Bodrov
works.description: Historical drama about early life of Genghis Khan. Nominated for Academy Award for Best Foreign Language Film.

properties.notes: Central character, portrayed building Versailles and consolidating absolute power
Subject of documentary series about her resistance to Portuguese colonization
Biography from childhood through establishment of Zulu kingdom
Central figure in film about English Civil War and Commonwealth period
Biographical film about his early life and development as playwright
Focus on creation of The Night Watch and artistic career
Epic biographical film spanning his entire life and independence movement
Based on his autobiography, covers imprisonment and presidency
Focus on scientific achievements and personal struggles
Another biographical portrayal emphasizing radioactivity research
Portrayed as honorable opponent during Crusades
Focuses on early life and rise to power
